result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobby Ray Strickland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to serve 1 year in the House of Correction, with 301 days credit, concurrent to any other sentence and Count 2.  Court orders the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Concurrent with: any other sentence and Count 2
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Defendant to pay fine of $750 plus all costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 8/3/15 or failure to pay will result in a civil judgment; cash bail on deposit to apply.
Defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 years with the mandatory reinstatement fee.

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 2 years.

Defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction, with 301 days credit concurrent to any other sentence and Count 1.
Concurrent with: any other sentence and count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobby Ray Strickland

Associated with Charge #1- CSR indicating that conviction was reported in error.
Associated with Charge #2
Associated with Charge #1-done in error

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 3.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 1 YEARS at the House of Corrections with 301 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence and Count 2.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 301 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence and Count 1.

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 2 YEARS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 2 YEARS   thereafter.

Court orders the defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 08/03/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $750.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Laboratory Report received and filed.

Filed, amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  

As to Amended Information as to Counts 1 & 2:    

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on February 3rd, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Michael Hansen--Milwaukee Police Officer.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Court held colloquy with defendant on his right to testify and right not to testify.  Defense motions to have five convictions not be used.  Court denies motion and allows for convictions be used for impeachment. Defense rests.  Evidentiary phase is complete.  Closing arguments made.  Court denies motion to suppress for reasons stated on the record.  




  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and Filed.

Count 1:  Possession of Narcotic Drugs; contrary to sec 961-41(3g)(am), 939-50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.
Count 2:  Operating with Restricted Controlled Substance in Blood - 4th Offense; contrary to sec 346-63(1)(am), 346.55(2)(am)4, a unclassified Misdemeanor.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Bobby Ray Strickland not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  State to respond by 11/3/2014.  Case adjourned for motion hearing and final pretrial on 11/13/2014 as 1:30 pm, and for jury trial on 12/3/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.   Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Motion to suppress physical evidence from vehicle- Illegal detention of driver and search of vehicle, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel would like to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 9/16/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Parties to decide on the statue to be used for the plea.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/26/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Bobby Ray Strickland not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in federal custody, and not in court today.  Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/6/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  State to do an order to produce defendant for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Bobby Ray Strickland not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/29/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, recevied and filed.  aw

Attorney Darryl E Smith in court, defendant Bobby Ray Strickland not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court believes bail is set appropriately.  Next court date remains set for 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
WCS intoxicated driver intervention report, received and filed.  aw
Attorney Smith requests a bail review.  Case adjourned for bail bond hearing on 4/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Defendant has $100.00 cash bail posted.  Court is not forfeiting cash bail already posted.  Defendant must post an additional $900.00 to be released.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to WCS for monitoring.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  NO alcohol, and Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant to have random drug tests and breathalyzers.  aw

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Louis Epps for attorney Darryl E Smith.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin Dennis Murphy.
NO FILE IN COURT.
Court addresses violation report.  Defendant's scram bracelet came off over the weekend, and Justice Point was unable to monitor the defendant.  Defendant also was unable to provide a specimen.  Court modifies bail.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Attorney Epps to inform attorney Smith of today's proceedings.  Defendant was taken into custody.  aw
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program violation report, recevied and filed.  aw

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is trying to get defendant into drug treatment court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 3/17/14.

14RM013621  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
3/9/14 vf

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Bobby Ray Strickland in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty plea as to misdemeanor count 2. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
